summary:
Heart failure (HF) happens when the heart can't pump blood properly. It can affect one or both sides of the heart. Common symptoms include trouble breathing, tiredness, and swollen legs. This condition is caused by various health issues, like heart disease, high blood pressure, or drinking too much alcohol.

Doctors diagnose HF using tests and exams. Treatment depends on how severe it is. It may include lifestyle changes, medicines, or devices to help the heart. In serious cases, surgery or a heart transplant might be needed. HF is a serious, common problem, especially in older adults.
title: Heart failure
